comment: Spotify TTS stutters, starts to read the title of song, stops then reads it out loud again. Sometimes it randomly turns down volume for a few seconds in middle of song.

title: not working on xiaomi MI3
comment: with my other phones the player is able to display song/artist/ album info without this software. but my new MI3 even after installing this software it does not show. may be problem with the phone software. running MIUI5   on ANDROID 4.4.2  please fix this it would be of great help

title: Play store version isn't working but F.Droid one is!
comment: I was using this app for a while from F.Droid. Then I got a new phone and used this version but it no longer worked in my 2010 Prius. I went back to the F.Droid version on my Nexus 5 and now it's working. Seems something is broken on this 1.4.0 version while 1.3.2 on F.Droid is still a good version.

title: Was brilliant, no longer works
comment: Easy set-up, love the white list idea... what a great (and free) app! UPDATE: no longer works.
Works great!

title: Simple and brilliant
comment: Love the app, does what it says. Going to be an app I cant live without

title: 4.4.2 still Not working for me
comment: Not sure if it's me but it's not working. .. Android 4.4.2 and played with the settings. Help.

title: Compatibility
comment: A list of compatible devices is needed. Not working with my Bionic/ 2013 VW. I know Bionic is capable because it worked with  99 Honda/Pioneer.

title: I'll rate it 5 because it's not your fault but..
comment: Samsung Galaxy updates to 4.3 broke AVRCP and the BT to Text feature for everything except stock music player and Google Music.

title: Doesn't work.
comment: All other apps that use avrcp work flawlessly on my nexus 5. This app does nothing.

title: Great app
comment: I accidently deleted app a while ago & wondering why 📱 info was not pushing to 📻. I finally figured it out & finally found app again. Works now!

title: Great Concept.
comment: Been looking for an app that does this for a while.  It does work, however it is not perfect for my OEM Subaru radio, but with a few tweaks I think it could be.  My radio only displays the first 12 characters of one artist/album/track field at a time, unless I push and hold a button, then it will display ~30 characters of one field.  Ideally there could be an option in botifier to autoscroll messages within the 12 character limit so that I could display full messages without hitting buttons.

title: Good app
comment: Best

title: Like the idea
comment: I've been waiting for something like this.  I have a suggestion: Please allow a configuration for Botifier to not respond to Bluetooth Controls. Why? When attempting to use this to send Slacker Radio information, the override of the bluetooth controls stops me from being able to change tracks, as well as it constantly pauses the music when I hit Play. So right now it is unusable for me in this instance, but could have great potential as there are so many Android music apps that don't support proper AVRCP track info.

title: WIP
comment: It won't display anything on my radio even though its should as my radio is compatible. Nonetheless, it's a great app and the dev keeps updating and making it better. Anyone on JB 4.3 should try it
Great app

title: Love it
comment: Such an awesome feature. Would gladly pay money

title: Galaxy note 2
comment: Can't get to work with note 2 and pioneer x5500-bhs

title: Works so far
comment: Works pretty well on pioneer AVH-5500 unit in my 2011 Subaru WRX. I do agree it should turn the volume back up after a set amount of time.  Update 9/15/2013: This app is getting better and better! Keep up the good work.

title: Great Idea!
comment: This is a great idea and worked well. Long texts won't come through completely but I assume that it's a limitation of my car's head unit.

title: Good idea, but didn't work for me.
comment: Running on a rooted s4 with stock ROM. Connected to Audi bluetooth audio system.  Update I have sent the developer an email based on his response to my 1 star. Bottom line the app didn't work for me. Android sends data over BT to the car (track, artist, image etc) so I have to assume that the app is incompatible with either a new phone or new car, as the phone is compatible with the car normally . Update 2 -  I have received a prompt response from Dev who is looking to troubleshoot the issue with me. Fingers crossed.
Thx for the more detailed information.

title: Best App Ever
comment: If you use a car, if it has AVRVP,  you need this app. It's awesome! Still a young app, but updates and fixes are rolling out lightning fast. Love it.

title: Message not displayed
comment: I have a 2010 Mazda6. On Whatsapp, only application name and notification description(the sender's name) displayed. Notification message does not display at all. I have Nexus 4, Android 4.3

title: Whitelist makes more sense indeed.
comment: Please integrate with Tasker to have more control over settings based on defined conditions.  Thanks.

title: Great idea just need some polish
comment: This is a great app, just a few tiny hiccups easy earn it 5 stars once fixed

title: Does not work with Ford Sync.
comment: Issue with terrible software on their end not this app. So it's unusable to me but great concept.

title: Brilliant concept, and works well!
comment: I'm giving this a full 5 stars - absolutely brilliant!  This could easily be a paid-app -  I would happily pay a couple of bucks for it. It's had several updates since launch, and now that you can "black-list" specific apps which you don't want to interrupt your music, ability to ignore "persistent" notifications, and time-out to clear notifications (returning audio to full volume), it's close to perfect. (Tested with Nexus 4 running stock 4.3, paired to a MY12 Mazda 6, with factory-integrated Bluetooth audio)
* Remove comment no longer applicable after users edit :)

title: Great start
comment: Its a great start but definitely needs an app blacklist also the latest update now causes persistent notifications to be pushed... This causes issues with media players that use the notification tray... as it consistently subdues the playing audio volume level.  Edit: just as I posted an update was pushed.

title: Not working for my nexus4/ford focus
comment: I cannot seem to get any notifications to work with my nexus 4 on 4.3 and my Ford focus with My Ford Touch. The artist/description data will not update. The test notification does not produce any results as well

title: Great job so far
comment: With the latest updates, it's working great! But a little too great. Causes Pandora to remain in a "dimmed" audio level, and if you have any ongoing notifications, ex: Signal Check Pro, or Sensorly, that's all you will see on the HU. And if you have the TTS option turned on in the app, all you hear is what the ongoing notification is. So +1 to the App Blacklist; or, merge with CM10.2 ;-) ~Krylon360

title: Promising start
comment: Great concept, but has issues with apps with persistent notifications (such as battery monitor pro) uninstalled for now, but promising concept! App-level blacklist would be perfect. Would also prefer if it didn't interrupt music.

title: Works great on 4.3
comment: I wish it scrolled a little faster but it works great. When I'm streaming music it slightly lowers the volume and displays the message until I hit a button on my head unit. Is it possible to make it lower the music only for a few seconds? Great app!

title: Has promise
comment: We need a way to blacklist entire apps, not just certain phrases. The text to speech function just doesn't work well at all with apps like music and podcast players that use notifications to control playback.

title: Can't make it work
comment: My car displays music track info from my phone OK but not the notifications (including the test ones).  Not sure why.  Does it clash with music player apps?

title: Works good
comment: Works pretty well. I would like a button to enable or disable Botifier completely. At this point I have to uninstall to temporarily disable it. Sometimes I don't want my text messages showing in my car.
You could disable it via disabling it again in security settings...

title: Doesn't seem to work (Update)
comment: But I refrained from giving it a below average rating since I'm not entirely sure that it wasn't due to incompatibility with my car (2010 UK-spec Ford Fiesta). The car radio normally only shows track name and play time even with Google Music and Pandora, so it may not be fully AVRCP compatible.  Update: the latest update works for me now, but a notification pauses whatever is playing, and it stays paused for as long as the message appears in the notification area.

title: Force close
comment: Force closes on cyanogenmod 10.2. Please fix.
Please update 1.1.0 was a bad version.

title: Getting there, great effort
comment: Love the concept, looking to future releases that will iron out several bugs  Only first notification tts enabled, subsequent notification does not play on nexus4 running stock 4.3 while on bluetooth

title: Great App
comment: This is an excellent app to keep you hands free while driving.  Works as advertised once you enable the notifier in your Security Settings.  My one issue is that the app turns your music down to give you the notification regardless of if Text to Speech is turned on our not, but when it does this it will not restore your music to the previous listening level until you dismiss the notification from your phone.  This completely eliminates what the app is trying to accomplish.  I hope the dev allows us to set a timer of maybe 10 seconds where the music volume will be reduced and the message displayed, then after that time the message will disappear and the volume will be restored to its previous level. Other than this tweak I think the app is excellent. Work great in my 2012 toyota Prius.

title: Great idea but needs work
comment: Need Hangouts support

title: Great idea
comment: Just needs some tweaking and features.  Hope there is a way to make music keep playing
Great app
Clever and Useful
